name: Introduction to Linguistics
description: This course serves as an introduction to the field of linguistics. It provides an overview of the various sub-disciplines and research methods within linguistics, as well as an introduction to the basics of language structure and use.

name: Morphology
description: This course provides an introduction to morphological theories, processes, and structures. It covers the basics of word formation, affixation, and the principles that govern morphological change.

name: Advanced Morphology
description: This course is a more in-depth exploration of morphological theory and structure. It covers topics such as morphology-syntax interactions, markedness, and the relation between morphology and phonology.
